intro: Erucastrum canariense var. cardaminoides, commonly known as the Canary Islands cress, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, exhibiting a low, sprawling growth habit. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. The leaves are alternate, lobed, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
